tasks.task: Plant peanuts in April and May
subtasks: Choose appropriate peanuts for planting
Prepare the soil for planting
Dig shallow furrows in the soil
Position peanuts in the furrows at the correct spacing
Cover the peanuts with soil, ensuring proper depth

tasks.task: Wait for peanuts to grow for four months
subtasks: Monitor soil moisture and water as needed
Check for pests and diseases, practicing integrated pest management
Tend to any necessary weeds through cultivation or mulching

tasks.task: Harvest peanuts four months after planting
subtasks: Determine the optimal time for harvesting based on peanut maturity
Dig up the peanuts carefully to avoid damaging the fruit
Remove peanuts from the soil and allow them to dry
Grade and sort peanuts for storage or sale
Recognize how the peanut flower develops into the underground fruit
Observe the role of the peg in peanut development
Application of integrated pest management principles
Timing of cultivation versus mulching strategies
